pr_title: Use reflection to pass resource type Enum on gPRC

timeline.message: Use reflection to pass resource type Enum on gPRC and make the SlidingWindow more generic
merged from master and fixed some conflicts
Use reflection to pass resource type Enum on gPRC and make the SlidingWindow more generic
merged from master and fixed some conflicts

Revert "merged from master and fixed some conflicts"

This reverts commit 7768878294a6bf9497d31e75587e9e9231016ef7.

timeline.bodyText: Can we do this without using reflection? I think its ok to have some boiler plate code here. Ideally, we should define objects that are sent over the network as protobuf objects to avoid this scenario.
timeline.author: ditac

replies.bodyText: Done. Created a ResourceType protobuf message instead and removed the use of  refection/regex from code.
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText:
Going back we have a plan to remove the evaluationIntervalSeconds because we think that RCA framework should be simple. It should just run every graph node at every tick. The node decides if it wants

to not do any work and return a empty flow unit.
to do some work and yet return a empty flow unit as it is not time to emit one
to do some work and emit a flow unit.

So basically the framework runs each graph node each time and it is upto the node to do whatever it wants and return a flow unit empty or otherwise.
So, we should try to not add the new rcaPeriod
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: I would go as far to recommend that we make sure that no RCA depends on evaluationIntervalSeconds(by that I mean no RCA requires to be scheduled at a particular interval or depend on that.) as part of this CR and make it vestigial and then in a subsequent CR we can remove it.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.message: made changes based on PR comments

timeline.bodyText: If we are converting the name unit to seconds, shouldn't the member variable name remain **_SECONDS ?
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: We start every log message inside the RCA package as RCA: to distinguish the log from the Reader. can we do the same here ?
timeline.author: yojs
